@anshkhannasbu Can you please fill in the PR template with description text?

> Can we rename the member `peers` to be `allKnownPeers` or similar? Something to try to prevent such an error in the future.
> 
> What about a test? Did you try to write a unit test to catch this? I think having 4 available workers, create a log, and then look at the raft groups and see that it has 4 members instead of 3 would work.

Sorry, it took so long to reply to you. about the log service, it is okay to verify according to the document (because the number of worker nodes is equal to the number of new raft groups), but when more than 3 worker nodes are started, a log is created at the time, the metadata service will broadcast the addition of Raft groups to unnecessary nodes outside the new raft group. 
Personal suggestion: Ratis server adds verification. when an additional raft group is received, verify that the new raft group members must contain the current working node

> 
> 1. assertCommitCount always fail. @anshkhannasbu Could you explain why `stmCount + configCount + metaCount == expectedMsgs i.e. 2` ?  Sorry, I can not get the point.
> 

@runzhiwang , u r right. The number client msgs should be equal to the stateMachine entries.
StateMachine + config + metadata should be equal to the total count of raft log entries.
@bshashikant Okay, I see, thanks for explanation.
@runzhiwang @bshashikant thanks for pointing this out. I assumed that in this case, the number of entries sent by client would be the total number of entries committed in the Log.

@lokeshj1703 Thanks for review.

> GrpcLogAppender should reset the client and retry the append entries. Are we seeing this behavior in the test?

Do you mean if exception happens, client should reset the client and retry the append entries ?
If so, I did not see this behavior in the test.

And the reason of the problem of this PR, is [handleReply(reply)](https://github.com/apache/incubator-ratis/blob/master/ratis-grpc/src/main/java/org/apache/ratis/grpc/server/GrpcServerProtocolService.java#L125) processed by different thread of future.

Thanks a lot for testing flatbuffer!  Some comments:
- Lets move the program to a new module ratis-experimental.  By default, the module wont be compiled.  It will be enabled by a profile.
- Please add some simple javadoc to describe the program.
The implementation is ready for review. Right now I am working on several unit test, hope I can fix them soon.

- Use 2-space indentation in ratis-experiments/pom.xml

@lokeshj1703 

The concern here is we need consider the atomicity of reading role and reading term.

For leader case, `LeaderState` has its member `private final long currentTerm;`, which is read only, meanwhile `RoleInfo` has its member `AtomicReference<LeaderState> leaderState`, which is an atomic variable, thus current `getRoleInfoProto()` can ensure the atomicity of reading role and reading term together.

But for candidate and follower, since `LeaderElection` and `FollowerState` does not record currentTerm. If we want to ensure of atomicity, we need lock entire `RaftServerImpl` to read role and call `getState().getCurrentTerm()`. But I didn't see the requirement of return candidate and follower with its term. So I prefer to just expose term when raft instance is leader.

@szetszwo  Hello Nicholas, could you please have a quick look for this PR ?

I consider that: 
1) withhold vote should be used for higher term from disruptive server, 
2) request vote can work correctly, but `shouldWithholdVotes` is redundant.

Since the change is critical, could you please double confirm. Thanks!

@lokeshj1703 @bshashikant Could you help review this patch ? Thank you very much.
How could new AutoCloseableLock(lock, preUnlock) throw an exception?

> Existed ut

Which one?
Is this blocked on a good CI run?

> How could new AutoCloseableLock(lock, preUnlock) throw an exception?

@szetszwo Thanks for review.

 For example, OOM happen when `new AutoCloseableLock`.

Actually, we met deadlock in production cluster because the lock of DataBlockingQueue can not be free, the related jira is [RATIS-1004](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/RATIS-1004) and jstack file has been attached in jira.  But from the stack we can not find why the lock can not be free. So we want to fix all the unsafe code.

Besides AutoCloseableLock is not thread safe, if anyone use it in multi-thread, it will also cause lock can not be free.

Current patch is still not perfect, so I want to replace all `try (AutoCloseable Lock = AutoCloseableLock.acquire(lock)) { statement }` with ` lock.lock()  try { statement  } finally { lock.unlock()}`.

 What do you think ?

> Actually, we met deadlock in production cluster because the lock of DataBlockingQueue can not be free, the related jira is RATIS-1004

Thanks for pointing out RATIS-1004.  Let's understand why there is a dead lock first.

> Could you give an example?

@szetszwo Sorry for my misunderstanding, `AutoCloseableLock` is thread safe.
